title: ‘No options can be ruled out,' says Carrie Lam when asked about a China intervention – video
text: Hong Kong's embattled leader Carrie Lam says city authorities should tackle the ongoing protests on their own, but refuses to rule out asking the Chinese government for help. 'If the situation becomes so bad, then no options could be ruled out,' she says when asked under what circumstances she would call upon Beijing for help to quell the protests. 'I cannot tell you categorically now under what circumstances we will do extra things, including ... calling on the central government to help,' she said. Last week, Lam invoked emergency powers to outlaw face masks, but the move inflamed demonstrations over the weekend and thousands took to the streets wearing masks in defiance. Lam insisted it was too early to say whether the mask ban was ineffective and urged youths not to participate in what she called political actions
description: Hong Kong's embattled leader Carrie Lam says city authorities should tackle the ongoing protests on their own, but refuses to rule out asking the Chinese government for help
